pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Friday, April 23, 2021 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

Private meetings.

8:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the Unleashing Climate Innovation session of the Leaders Summit on Climate, hosted by the President of the United States, Joe Biden. He will be joined by the Minister of Environment and Climate Change Jonathan Wilkinson and the Minister of International Development Karina Gould.

The Summit will be streamed live via the following link: www.state.gov/climatesummit

9:15 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the Economic Opportunities of Climate Action session of the Leaders Summit on Climate, hosted by the President of the United States, Joe Biden. He will be joined by the Minister of Environment and Climate Change Jonathan Wilkinson and the Minister of International Development Karina Gould.

The Summit will be streamed live via the following link: www.state.gov/climatesummit

11:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will address Canadians on the COVID-19 situation and hold a media availability. Minister of Public Services and Procurement Anita Anand and Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness Bill Blair will be in attendance.

Room 200
Sir John A. Macdonald Building
144 Wellington Street

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media wishing to cover the event must be accredited with the Parliamentary Press Gallery.
  • Journalists can dial in to listen and ask questions.
  • Participant dial-in numbers:
    Local: 613-954-9003
    Toll-free: 1-866-206-0153
    Pass code: 6822783#

12:45 p.m. The Prime Minister and Sophie Grégoire Trudeau will receive their first dose of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine.

Note for media:

  • Restricted pooled coverage

4:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will virtually meet with physicians, nurses, and other primary care providers from the Mosaic Primary Care Network in Calgary. The Mayor of Calgary Naheed Nenshi and City Councillor for Ward 5 George Chahal will be in attendance.

The meeting will be streamed live on the Prime Minister’s official Twitter account: https://twitter.com/CanadianPM.
